newsitem.title: SWEDEN: KINNEVIK BOOSTS MTG CAPITAL FOR SPIN-OFF.
newsitem.headline: KINNEVIK BOOSTS MTG CAPITAL FOR SPIN-OFF.

text.p: Swedish holding company Kinnevik said on Thursday it would capitalise its media subsidiary Modern Times Group (MTG) in a bid to prepare it for the planned spin-off to shareholders on September 15.

Kinnevik said in an MTG earnings statement that it changed more than 750 million crowns of its net claims on MTG to shareholders' equity of 326 million crowns and a convertible promissory note of 424 million crowns.
The loan will expire at the end of 2000 and carries three percent interest.

Kinnevik will also transfer capital through an option for MTG to buy 1.55 million shares in Millicom International Cellular (MIC) at a redemption price of 100 million crowns, corresponding to a premium of about 600 million crowns.
The option corresponds to nine percent of Kinnevik's 34 percent stake in MIC whose value has risen to 7.5 billion crowns from 3.6 billion from the start of the year.
"The choice to have an option for the additional funds can mainly be attributed to tax reasons," Kinnevik's chief executive Stig Nordin said in the statement.
After the capitalisation, MTG's equity-to-assets ratio will be 51 percent, excluding the option.
MTG's loss after financial items widened to 193 million crowns for the first half of 1997 from a loss of 74 million a year earlier, Kinnevik said.

Its operating result swung to a loss of 164 million crowns from a profit of 43 million crowns. The 1996 first half figure included a one-off net positive effect of 145 million crowns from changing over to a new satellite platform.
"The considerable softening of the Scandinavian currencies against currencies in which MTG has a large part of its costs has had a significant impact on MTG's result in the period," Kinnevik said.
It added results from MTG's cost savings programme, initiated in 1996, were gradually showing and repeated that further cost savings were underway.
